intro: Sibbaldia congesta, commonly known as the clustered sibbaldia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine environments and is adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions. Sibbaldia congesta is often found in rocky soils and is a characteristic component of alpine meadows.
